column4: HI! I was having problems wiht my wifi card (signal was way too low) so I did some stuff, but now I dont even see the wireless device in network manager
I am running ubuntu 11.10
I blacked listed some drivers, however I have removed those again and restarted
Do you recall what the device was named?
Um, I guess not? YOu mean like wlan0?
I'd check to see if it still shows in ifconfig. Yes - like wlan0
You can also use the iw* tools perhaps - iwevent can show you what's going on etc.
I'm assuming you don't get anything back when you try a reboot (I hate suggesting reboots, but this case it might be quickest)
Ya iwconfig reports no wireless extensions
i have restarted a bunch of times :)
That's kind of strange - nothing is coming to mind off the top of my head - do you remember the kernel module that your wireless would want to use?
i.e. atheros, broadcom etc.
definitely broadcom I have 4313
I'd run lsmod to see if you even have the driver loading
I don't remember the module name off the top of my head, but you might also try to use modprobe to insert it
Something like: sudo modprobe bcm4313  # change the name to match the acutal module
Unfortunately I stopped memorizing modules :)
bbiab
I dont see the module in lsmod :/ Its definitely enabled
I even installed windows driver with ndiswrapper just to see if i can get it recognized but I still didnt get anything after a restart
I want to reload the brcm80211 drivers for the device, just not sure how
